alert.note: Alert for Buena Vista; Cherokee; Clay; Ida; O'Brien; Woodbury (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued April 12 at 3:11AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FAR SOUTHEAST SOUTH DAKOTA, NORTHWEST IOWA AND FAR SOUTHERN MINNESOTA... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST SOUTH DAKOTA, NORTHWEST IOWA, AND SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA... .DISCUSSION... Issued at 306 AM CDT Wed Apr 12 2023 Main channel of strongest winds shifts a bit southeastward today compared to yesterday with the best chances of gusts in the 25-35 mph near and southeast of a Yankton to Jackson line. Outside of this area, afternoon relative humidity values will still work into critical thresholds near and south of I-90. Fire Weather Watch was converted to a Red Flag Warning for a few counties but remaining counties look to hold short of the wind criteria component. Certainly a trend to monitor through the morning however as conditions remain elevated either way. Corridor of strongest winds lifts back to the northwest for Thursday and strengthens further. Forecast guidance continues to show the potential for wind gusts in the 30-40+ mph range, strongest across NW IA. More mixed guidance such as the RAP/HRRR which has been verifying best would also push RH values at or below critical thresholds for locations southeast of a Tyndall to Brookings line. Will go ahead an issue a Fire Weather Watch for highest confidence zones but this will need to be reevaluated as fuel conditions from areas of recent snowmelt are evaluated as well as refinement on where the meandering boundary ends up. A strong cold front will push through Friday bringing falling temperatures and precipitation chances. People are urged to exercise extreme care with respect to outdoor activities that could cause grass fires. Avoid equipment that can cause sparks near dry grass or brush. Do not toss cigarettes on the ground. Report new fires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly, becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. OUTLOOK FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON...The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the extreme category. The grassland fire danger product reflects fire danger for native grasses. It is not intended for cured agricultural crops, nor will it reflect conditions in road ditches which have been mowed.
